intro: Senecio stylotrichus, commonly known as the African marguerite, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces showy yellow flowers that are surrounded by white ray florets, making it visually striking. Senecio stylotrichus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its hardy nature and attractive blooms.
